Description: The Tribulations of St Antony; the saint is in mid-air, tormented by demons. c.1469-73 Engraving
Curator's comments: Stogdon notes that impressions of the first state of this print are watermarked with paper used 1469-73 (see Hollstein Introduction). See A. Griffiths (ed.), 'Landmarks in Print Collecting, Connoisseurs and Donors at the British Museum since 1753', BM, 1996, cat. 72.
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / German engravings, etchings and woodcuts c.1400-1700 (54.II)
Lehrs 1908-34 / Geschichte und kritische Katalog des deutschen, niederländischen und französischen Kupferstichs im XV Jahrhundert (V.243.54.II)
Exhibition history: 1996 Apr-Jun, Houston, Museum of Fine Arts, Landmarks 1996 Jul-Sep, LA, Huntington Library and AG, Landmarks 1996, Oct-Dec, Baltimore, Museum of Arts, Landmarks 1997 Jan-Apr, Minneapolis Institute of Arts, Landmarks 2003/4 Sep-Jan, Tarragona, Sala Tarragona, Masters of Printmaking 2004 Feb-April, Palma, Fundacio 'la Caixa', Masters of Printmaking 2004 April-July, Lleida, Fundacio 'la Caixa', Masters of Printmaking 2014-15 Sept - Jan.London, BM, Witches and Wicked Bodies
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Col John Wingfield Malcolm
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: John Malcolm of Poltalloch
